Package camzup.core

Class Edge2

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Edge2
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Edge2>
public class Edge2
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Edge2>
Organizes components of a 2D mesh into an edge with an origin and destination. This is not used by a mesh internally; it is created upon retrieval from a mesh.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    Vert2 dest
    The destination vertex.
    Vert2 origin
    The origin vertex.

    Constructs an edge from the origin and destination coordinate and texture coordinate data.
    Edge2​(Vert2 origin, Vert2 dest)
    Constructs an edge from two vertices, an origin and destination.

    static int sharedCoord​(Edge2 a, Edge2 b)
    Tests to see if two edges share a vertex coordinate: Returns -1 when a's origin is b's destination. Returns -2 when a's destination is b's destination Returns 1 when a's destination is b's origin. Returns 2 when a's origin is b's origin. Returns 0 when none of the above conditions are met. Assuming a mesh is properly wound, a value of 1 implies that two edges belong to the same face; of 2, different neighboring faces.

      public Edge2 rotateZGlobal​(float radians)

    • rotateZLocal

      public Edge2 rotateZLocal​(float cosa, float sina, Vec2 center)
      Rotates the coordinates of this edge by the sine and cosine of an angle around the z axis. The edge's center (midpoint) acts as a pivot. The texture coordinates are unaffected.
      Parameters:
      cosa - cosine of the angle
      sina - sine of the angle
      center - the center
      Returns:
      this edge
      See Also:
      Vec2.sub(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2), Vec2.rotateZ(Vec2, float, float, Vec2), Vec2.add(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • scaleLocal

      public Edge2 scaleLocal​(float scalar, Vec2 center)
      Scales the coordinates of this edge. Subtracts the edge's mean center (midpoint) from each vertex, scales, then adds the mean center.
      Parameters:
      scalar - the uniform scalar
      center - the edge center
      Returns:
      this edge

      Vec2.sub(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2), Vec2.mul(Vec2, float, Vec2), Vec2.add(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • eval

      public static Vec2 eval​(Edge2 edge, float step, Vec2 target)
      Finds a point on the edge given a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] . Uses linear interpolation from the origin coordinate to that of the destination. To find an edge's midpoint, use the step 0.5 .
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge
      step - the step
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the point

    • heading

      public static float heading​(Edge2 edge)
      Finds the heading of an edge. Subtracts the destination coordinate from that of the origin, then supplies the difference to atan2 .
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge
      Returns:
      the heading
      See Also:
      Utils.atan2(float, float)

    • mag

      public static float mag​(Edge2 edge)
      Finds the Euclidean distance from the edge's origin coordinate to that of its destination.
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge
      Returns:
      the magnitude
      See Also:
      Vec2.distEuclidean(Vec2, Vec2)

    • magSq

      public static float magSq​(Edge2 edge)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the magnitude
      See Also:

    • projectVector

      public static Vec2 projectVector​(Edge2 edge, Vec2 v, Vec2 target)
      Projects a vector, representing a point, onto an edge. The scalar projection is clamped to the range [0.0, 1.0] , meaning the projection will not exceed the edge's origin and destination.
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge
      v - the input vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the projection
      See Also:
      Utils.clamp01(float)

    • sharedCoord

      public static int sharedCoord​(Edge2 a, Edge2 b)
      Tests to see if two edges share a vertex coordinate:
      • Returns -1 when a's origin is b's destination.
      • Returns -2 when a's destination is b's destination
      • Returns 1 when a's destination is b's origin.
      • Returns 2 when a's origin is b's origin.
      • Returns 0 when none of the above conditions are met.
      Assuming a mesh is properly wound, a value of 1 implies that two edges belong to the same face; of 2, different neighboring faces. A positive value implies counter-clockwise winding (CCW), or right-handedness; a negative value, clockwise winding (CW), or left-handedness.

      If the left and right comparisand are the same, returns 2.
      Parameters:
      a - the left comparisand
      b - the right comparisand
      Returns:
      the evaluation
